meanings.sent1: The mayor will be gazetting the new city ordinance tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The government gazetted the new law in the official newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The town crier enjoyed gazetting the news to the villagers.
meanings.sent4: The teacher gazetted the exam results, causing excitement among the students.
meanings.sent5: The company gazetted the job openings, attracting many applicants.

meanings.definition: To list or record in a gazette
meanings.sent1: The historian is gazetting all the important events of the year.
meanings.sent2: The editor gazetted the names of the winners in the magazine.
meanings.sent3: The librarian mistakenly gazetted the wrong book in the catalog.
meanings.sent4: The archivist gazetted the rare documents for preservation.
meanings.sent5: The secretary gazetted the meeting minutes for everyone to review.
